headline: What It’s Like to Use Facebook When You’re Blind
abstract: For years, scrolling through my newsfeed was frustrating and confusing. Then facial recognition came along.
lead_paragraph: Imagine scrolling through Facebook with all the images blacked out. You can read your friends’ jokes and their commentary on the links they share. But vacation photos? Visual memes? A video of an old school friend’s anniversary party? All of these visuals, with their rich details and subtexts, are concealed from view.
